update.description:
Basic validator for artifact locations. Loads a performer with a marker, spotlight, and camera which can be moved to various artifacts.

Start a world with `ign launch -v 4 validate_artifacts.ign worldName:=tunnel_circuit_practice_01`

In a separate terminal, scan through the levels until all artifact poses have been retrieved via:  
`ign service -s /artifact/scan --reqtype ignition.msgs.StringMsg --reptype ignition.msgs.StringMsg --timeout 1000 --req 'data: ""'`

Then iterate through artifacts.

`ign service -s /artifact/next --reqtype ignition.msgs.StringMsg --reptype ignition.msgs.StringMsg --timeout 1000 --req 'data: ""'`

The service will respond with the artifact name that you are viewing, and you can use the GUI to look through the two cameras \(one top-down, one at a 45 deg angle\)
update.title: Basic artifact validator

content.raw:
Hmm, I’ve been scanning levels until all artifact poses are detected before I start iterating artifacts.  We could certainly add some warnings here.

Another thing I tried was scanning through all of the levels at the beginning, but I ran into issues loading/unloading all of the levels that quickly.  I may need to recheck that with the SceneBroadcaster improvements.
content.html:
Hmm, I’ve been scanning levels until all artifact poses are detected before I start iterating artifacts. We could certainly add some warnings here.

Another thing I tried was scanning through all of the levels at the beginning, but I ran into issues loading/unloading all of the levels that quickly. I may need to recheck that with the SceneBroadcaster improvements.

content.raw: Only going through valid artifacts makes it impossible to detect artifacts with improperly configured levels. For my test, it only showed 8/20 artifacts. Could it maybe just jump to one of the levels containing the invalid artifact instead of silently going back to the first artifact?
content.html: Only going through valid artifacts makes it impossible to detect artifacts with improperly configured levels. For my test, it only showed 8/20 artifacts. Could it maybe just jump to one of the levels containing the invalid artifact instead of silently going back to the first artifact?
